The French convoy officer said rapidly, "We must halt here: the Emperor will pass here immediately; it will please him to see these gentlemen prisoners."
Another officer said, "There are so many prisoners today, nearly the whole Russian army, that he is probably tired of them."
The first officer said, "All the same! They say this one is the commander of all the Emperor Alexander’s Guards," indicating a Russian officer in the white uniform of the Horse Guards.
Bolkónski recognized Prince Repnín whom he had met in Petersburg society.
Beside Prince Repnín stood a lad of nineteen, also a wounded officer of the Horse Guards.
Napoleon, having come up at a gallop, stopped his horse.

Napoleon asked Prince Repnín, "You are the commander of the Emperor Alexander’s regiment of Horse Guards?"
Prince Repnín replied, "I commanded a squadron."
Napoleon said, "Your regiment fulfilled its duty honorably."
Prince Repnín said, "The praise of a great commander is a soldier’s highest reward."
Napoleon said, "I bestow it with pleasure."
Napoleon asked, "And who is that young man beside you?"
Prince Repnín named Lieutenant Sukhtélen.
After looking at him, Napoleon smiled.

Napoleon said, "A splendid reply!"
Napoleon said, "Young man, you will go far!"

Napoleon said, "Well, and you, young man, how do you feel, mon brave?"
